page.title: 08ASHPERTON VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The hall was built as a memorial hall in 1923 on land given by the Hopton family. It was built of stone with an asbestos tiled roof with a kitchen for tea- making and washing- up. Cloakrooms were added soon after. It is 58ft by 24ft and 17ft high at the ridge. It is heated by hot water pipes with electric radiators for extra warmth. The hall holds 150 people and has regular bookings by local groups. The Women's Institute and Over 60's meet monthly and the Mothers and Toddlers weekly but there are also dances, private parties, whist drives and bingo evenings. The Parish Council is responsible for the appointment of the committee which administers the hall. Groups making the bookings look after the cleaning and good order of the premises.No-one seems interested in holding the post of caretaker.
